body:
Also occurs with default parser:
```bash
echo '() => { return }' > cannot-read-value-of-null.js
 /usr/bin/env eslint --no-eslintrc --parser-options '{"sourceType":"module"}' --rule '{"arrow-body-style":1}' cannot-read-value-of-null.js
```
Thanks for the report, I can reproduce this issue.
@not-an-aardvark mind if i take this one?

issue.title: Fix: allow no tokens after `return` keyword (fixes #10372)

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

labels.name: archived due to age
labels.description: This issue has been archived; please open a new issue for any further discussion

issue.title: Get Cannot read property 'value' of null when i use arrow-function in the es6 class syntax (arrow-body-style)

labels.name: evaluating
labels.description: The team will evaluate this issue to decide whether it meets the criteria for inclusion

labels.name: archived due to age
labels.description: This issue has been archived; please open a new issue for any further discussion

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

issue.body:
<!--
    ESLint adheres to the [JS Foundation Code of Conduct](https://js.foundation/community/code-of-conduct).

    This template is for bug reports. If you are here for another reason, please see below:

    1. To propose a new rule: https://eslint.org/docs/developer-guide/contributing/new-rules
    2. To request a rule change: https://eslint.org/docs/developer-guide/contributing/rule-changes
    3. To request a change that is not a bug fix, rule change, or new rule: https://eslint.org/docs/developer-guide/contributing/changes
    4. If you have any questions, please stop by our chatroom: https://gitter.im/eslint/eslint

    Note that leaving sections blank will make it difficult for us to troubleshoot and we may have to close the issue.
-->

**Tell us about your environment**

* **ESLint Version:** v4.17.0
* **Node Version:** v9.11.1
* **npm Version:** 5.6.0
* **vistual studio code Version:** 1.24.1

**What parser (default, Babel-ESLint, etc.) are you using?** babel-eslint

**Please show your full configuration:**

<details>
<summary>Configuration</summary>

<!-- Paste your configuration below: -->
```js
module.exports = {
  parser: 'babel-eslint',
  plugins: ['import', 'recommend-import'],
  extends: 'airbnb',
  env: {
    es6: true,
    browser: true,
    node: true,
  },
  rules: {
    'max-len': [2, 240, 2, { ignoreUrls: true, ignoreComments: false }],
    'no-underscore-dangle': 0,
    'no-mixed-operators': 0,
    'function-paren-newline': 0,
    'arrow-parens': 0,
    'object-curly-newline': 0,
    'prefer-destructuring': 0,
    'no-shadow': 1,
    'react/forbid-prop-types': 0,
    'react/jsx-boolean-value': 0,
    'react/jsx-filename-extension': 0,
    'react/jsx-no-bind': 0,
    'react/no-array-index-key': 0,
    'react/prefer-stateless-function': 0,
    'react/sort-comp': 0,
    'react/no-did-mount-set-state': 0,
    'react/require-default-props': 1,
    'react/no-unused-prop-types': 1,
    'jsx-a11y/click-events-have-key-events': 0,
    'jsx-a11y/heading-has-content': 0,
    'jsx-a11y/no-noninteractive-element-interactions': 0,
    'jsx-a11y/no-static-element-interactions': 0,
    'jsx-a11y/media-has-caption': 0,
    'jsx-a11y/no-autofocus': 0,
    'jsx-a11y/label-has-for': 1,
    'jsx-a11y/anchor-is-valid': 1,
    'jsx-a11y/alt-text': 1,
    'jsx-a11y/anchor-has-content': 1,
    'jsx-a11y/iframe-has-title': 1,
    'import/no-extraneous-dependencies': 0,
    'import/no-named-as-default': 0,
    'recommend-import/no-import-lib': 2,
    'react/require-default-props': 0,
    'react/prop-types': [2, { ignore: ['children', 'location'] }],
    camelcase: ['error'],
    'comma-dangle': [
      'error',
      {
        arrays: 'always-multiline',
        objects: 'always-multiline',
        imports: 'always-multiline',
        exports: 'always-multiline',
        functions: 'ignore',
      },
    ],
  },
  
  globals: {
    location: true,
    isFinite: true,
    window: true,
  },
};
```

</details>

**What did you do? Please include the actual source code causing the issue, as well as the command that you used to run ESLint.**

<!-- Paste the source code below: -->
```js
class A extends React.Component {
  constructor(props){
     super(props);
  }
  
  customerFunc = item => {
     return // when i enter the 'return' code, the eslint is broken.
  }
}
```

**What did you expect to happen?**
no error
**What actually happened? Please include the actual, raw output from ESLint.**
I got the error stack from the VS code panel.
```bash
[Error - 12:06:23] ESLint stack trace:
[Error - 12:06:23] TypeError: Cannot read property 'value' of null
    at Object.isOpeningBraceToken (/User/workspace/node_modules/eslint/lib/ast-utils.js:354:17)
    at validate (/User/workspace/node_modules/eslint/lib/rules/arrow-body-style.js:127:41)
    at listeners.(anonymous function).forEach.listener (/User/workspace/node_modules/eslint/lib/util/safe-emitter.js:47:58)
    at Array.forEach (native)
    at Object.emit (/User/workspace/node_modules/eslint/lib/util/safe-emitter.js:47:38)
    at NodeEventGenerator.applySelector (/User/workspace/node_modules/eslint/lib/util/node-event-generator.js:251:26)
    at NodeEventGenerator.applySelectors (/User/workspace/node_modules/eslint/lib/util/node-event-generator.js:280:22)
    at NodeEventGenerator.leaveNode (/User/workspace/node_modules/eslint/lib/util/node-event-generator.js:303:14)
    at CodePathAnalyzer.leaveNode (/User/workspace/node_modules/eslint/lib/code-path-analysis/code-path-analyzer.js:630:23)
    at Traverser.leave [as _leave] (/User/workspace/node_modules/eslint/lib/linter.js:1009:32)
```

body:
Getting exactly this error with following:
**.eslintrc**
```
{
    "extends": "airbnb",
    "rules": {
        "quotes": ["error", "double"],
        "comma-dangle": ["error", "never"],
        "arrow-parens": ["error", "as-needed"],
        "curly": ["error", "all"],
        "brace-style": ["error", "1tbs"],
        "padded-blocks": ["error", { "classes": "always", "blocks": "never" }],
        "object-curly-newline": [
            "error",
            {
                "ImportDeclaration": { "multiline": true, "minProperties": 3 }
            }
        ],
        "indent": ["error", 4],
        "class-methods-use-this": "off",
        "import/prefer-default-export": "off",
        "react/jsx-filename-extension": "off",
        "react/jsx-one-expression-per-line": "off",
        "react/prop-types": "warn",
        "react/jsx-indent": ["error", 4],
        "react/jsx-indent-props": ["error", "first"],
        "react/button-has-type": "off",
        "react/destructuring-assignment": "warn",
        "jsx-a11y/label-has-for": "off"
    },
    "plugins": ["mocha"],
    "env": {
        "mocha": true,
        "browser": true
    }
}
```
**.babelrc**
```
{
  "presets": ["env", "react"],
  "plugins": ["transform-object-rest-spread"]
}
```
**dependencies**
```
"eslint": "^4.19.1",
"eslint-config-airbnb": "^17.0.0"
"eslint-plugin-import": "^2.13.0"
"eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y": "^6.0.3"
"eslint-plugin-mocha": "^5.0.0"
"eslint-plugin-react": "^7.10.0"

node v8.11.2
npm 6.1.0
```
If this is still happening with the latest version of ESLint, may you please open a new issue? Thanks!
